info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Little Cypress Bayou Near Jefferson affecting Harrison, Gregg, Marion and Upshur Counties.
For the Little Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Cypress Bayou near Jefferson.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowland flooding will slowly decrease, however, the creek will remain above flood stage for several more days.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 17.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 12/11/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 1100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Gregg, TX; Harrison, TX; Marion, TX; Upshur, TX
